ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Digest Number 1032
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Hehe, actually I got into a similar group this morning in Lower Guk.  They were so pitiful I couldn t believe it.  After recovering my corpse, I just
ygData.messageBody:
> Date: Fri, 30 Jun 2000 12:44:03 -0600
> From: "Kimes, Dean W." <dean_kimes@...>
>Subject: RE: E'Ci Bards on the list
>
>Hey! That was you! I knew it started with an O, but I was honestly so
>disgusted with my guildmates ridiculous antics I couldn't think straight.
>That's the first time I have ever just camped from a group without so much
>as a see ya later. I did warn them beforehand and told the other poor
>unfortunate caught in their stupidity I was leaving.

Hehe, actually I got into a similar group this morning in Lower Guk. They
were so pitiful I couldn't believe it. After recovering my corpse, I just
logged in disgust and went to clean the house and do laundry... More fun
than fighting with them... lol


>Hey on a side note Olgwinn, do you, or anyone out there in fact, know what
>level the scorponids in The Overthere are?
>
> Kitasi


The Scorpicus are between level 30 and 35 I think. And they are SK's, which
means harm touch and low level necro spells. They also give bad Venril
Sather faction, so use care in case you happen to run into the evil outpost
for groceries (which are expensive as hell, anyone else notice that???) I
assume you are interested in the scorpicus scrounger for the Nostrolo
Tambourine quest. Well, in case it helps, the other day I and a level 42
wizzie killed one. Basically I ran over to where the chasm starts (where
they live), tracked the nearest Scorpicus Scrounger, and ran in with Selos
and Elemental Rythms going. Tagged him (and another unfortunately decided
to join, although the rest left me alone) and carefully drew him out towards
the zone where my wizzie was waiting. Keep Selos going (just in case), but
go slowly or you will lose it. Also keep Elemental Rythms going to protect
you from the stuff he'll try to hit you with. We finished it off fairly
quickly.

First one I pulled up had a coin. Case closed.

Oh, and a level 41 bard ran into me at the zone Friday night and said, "Hey,
it's Olgwinn from the eq bards list!" hehe

Olgwinn Pendragun
Bard of 39 Missed Notes
E'Ci
